screenshots.description: Some text and all printable ascii characters. The text should be at the bottom of the screen.
Wikipedia logo. May be slightly stretched in kitty.
Wikipedia logo and some columns.
Wikipedia logo. May be slightly stretched in kitty.
Wikipedia logo and some columns.
Wikipedia logo (slightly stretched in kitty). The cursor should be at the top left corner.
Wikipedia logo and some columns. The cursor should be at the top left corner of the last column image.
Wikipedia logo (slightly stretched in kitty). The cursor should be at the top left corner.
Wikipedia logo and some columns. The cursor should be at the top left corner of the last column image.
A grid of penguins of various sizes. On kitty they may be stretched.
A grid of penguins of various sizes. On kitty they may be stretched.
A ruler that goes off the screen. Not to scale.
A ruler that goes off the screen. Not to scale.
Three penguins, arranged diagonally. The top one is cut off.
Three penguins, arranged diagonally. The top one is cut off.
Three penguins arranged vertically. The bottom one is cut off because the terminal shouldn't introduce new lines when C=1.
Three penguins arranged vertically. The bottom one is cut off because the terminal shouldn't introduce new lines when C=1.

Images with different ids.
Images with different ids.
Images with different ids and placement ids.
Images with different ids and placement ids.
Dice with a square patch of red backround in the middle (underneath the image). The right 1/3 of the square is covered with green Xs. The Xs may behave differently in different terminals.
Dice with a red square in the middle (hiding part of image). The right 1/3 of the square is covered with green Xs.
Tux, wiki, and then dice on the next line.
Small arrow, wiki, and dice. 7 rows each, the number of columns is inferred
Dice, wiki, and small arrow. 20 columns each, the number of rows is inferred
Text boxes, the number of rows/columns is inferred
Same subimage of wikipedia, different sizes
Same subimage of wikipedia, different sizes
An image sliced horizontally, may be stretched, but without gaps
An image sliced horizontally, may be stretched, but without gaps
An image sliced horizontally, may be stretched, but without gaps
An image sliced vertically, may be stretched, but without gaps
An image sliced vertically, may be stretched, but without gaps
An image sliced vertically, may be stretched, but without gaps
Small arrow, subimage, w and h are way out of bounds, but we expect them to be truncated and there will not be much empty space
Small arrow, subimage, w and h are way out of bounds. rows and columns are explicitly specified, the behavior is the same
A very thin vertical slice of wiki repeated 3 times. Note the alignment.
A very thin vertical slice of wiki repeated 3 times. Note the alignment.
Both x and y are oob. Most probably the image will be empty, but most importantly the terminal shouldn't crash or hang.
Both x and y are negative. The image may be empty or just the image without additional margins, but most importantly the terminal shouldn't crash or hang.
Both w and h are negative. The image may be empty or display some part of the image, but most importantly the terminal shouldn't crash or hang.
